description._content: "[Thomas] Hely's original residence, a fine type of early colonial architecture, with immensely thick walls and squat doors and windows, stands...surrounded by a lovely garden, English plants and flowers were in full bloom." - Frank Walker The owner of Old Guard House, Frederick Augustus Hely, was the Principal Superintendent of Convicts at the time that he purchased "Wyoming" in 1824. Hely was born at Belfast, Ireland in 1794. There are various theories as to what unspeakable horrors awaited convicts in the Guard House as punishment, but it is most likely that this was used as a Garden House for Georgina Hely. Source: www.gosford.nsw.gov.au/library/local_history/Suburbs/docu... Image digitised from 'Early Australian Architecture', a book compiled by Frank Walker in 1942. This image is part of a collection entitled ‘Touring the Past - Tourism and History in Australia', which is available to view on the Royal Australian Historical Society's Historypin Channel. Access the collection at the following link: www.historypin.com/channels/view/id/48441/#|collections/v... Please feel free to comment on this or any of the other images in the collection. If you have more accurate information regarding the location and/or date of the image, we would love to hear from you!
